title: Drawing, "Competition Design for La Fenice, Venice: Longitudinal Section", 1788
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash and watercolor, graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: In pen and black ink on rose colored lower margin, center: "SPACCATO P IL LUNGO."; in lower right corner: "T.^VI"
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli (1845-1926), Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Longitudinal cross-section of a theater (in shades of rose and gray), showing an auditorium composed of five tiers of boxes (34 boxes on each tier) and the stage. Arched entryway at left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Competition Design for La Fenice, Venice: Longitudinal Section", 1788.
1788. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash and watercolor, graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-119.
